Here's how you know

Official websites use .gov
A .gov website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.

Secure .gov websites use HTTPS
A lock ( ) or https:// means you've safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.

    Spark-Seed-Spread

    Changing how employees identify and solve problems through training and
    accelerated operationalized innovation.

    Spark-Seed-Spread

    Our Goal

    The Spark-Seed-Spread Innovation Investment Program seeks to identify and accelerate employee-inspired innovations that improve health experiences for Veterans, families, caregivers, and employees. This program invests in both employees themselves and their innovative solutions through iNET’s Accelerator Program, which is the immersive learning and professional development component that comes along with the Spark-Seed-Spread investment.

    Spark

    Encourages creativity and inspires permission-less innovation on a very small scale

    Seed

    Testing a prototype for user experience feedback

    Spread

    Continuing iterative user testing at multiple VA facilities to finalize a prototype

    Investing in Employees and Innovations

    See a Full List of FY2024 Investees

    FY24 investees are “Driving Innovation Forward” with a large field of new ideas and innovations from across VA. You can see a full list of the Spark, Seed, and Spread Investees and their projects here.

    Investee Spotlight

    Male Contraceptive Initiative

    Dr. John DeCaro, a urologist from Augusta, identified a gap in knowledge and discussion around male contraception. Now a Spark-Seed-Seed investee, John is expanding awareness to male Veterans through a three-pronged approach known as the “Male Contraceptive Initiative.”

    Innovation Spotlight

    The Prosthetic Sock Management Tool (PSMT)

    The PSMT can enhance a Veteran's prosthetic experience. Now available on the VA Intraprenuerial Product Marketplace, this two-part organizational system aids in understanding and health management for prosthetic sock use.

    Alumni Spotlight

    Minh Ho

    Minh Ho, Acting Chief of Infectious Disease, Clinical Hospital Epidemiologist, and Staff Physician at Orlando VA Medical Center, and his team of pharmacists, social workers, and nurses are introducing new ways of thinking across VHA. Through harm reduction measures, Minh is striving to provide Veterans with safe and reliable access to life-saving tools, such as clean syringes, fentanyl test strips, and wound care products.

    In Crisis? Get Help Now

    We’re here anytime, day or night - 24/7

    If you are a Veteran in crisis or concerned about one, connect with our caring, qualified responders for confidential help. Many of them are Veterans themselves.

    • Call 1-800-273-8255 and press 1
    • Text to 838255
    • Chat confidentially now
    • Call TTY if you have hearing loss 1-800-799-4889

    Get more resources at VeteransCrisisLine.net.
